content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron gear wheel production line at position around (16.0, 71.0) to (21.5, 73.5)  
Consists of the following connected entities forming a production chain for iron gear wheels:  
- Burner mining drill at position (16.0, 71.0) extracting iron ore, currently fueled with coal (fuel inventory 44) but output blocked due to no sink entity accepting output on ground  
- Stone furnace at position (17.0, 73.0) smelting iron ore into iron plates, fueled with coal (fuel inventory 46), currently working with iron ore input and iron plate output  
- Burner inserter at position (17.5, 71.5) moving iron ore from mining drill to furnace, currently out of fuel and waiting for source items  
- Burner inserter at position (19.5, 73.5) taking iron gear wheels from assembling machine, out of fuel and waiting for source items  
- Burner inserter at position (23.5, 73.5) feeding iron plates into assembling machine, out of fuel and waiting for space in destination  
- Wooden chest at position (18.5, 73.5) collecting iron gear wheels, currently empty  
- Assembling machine 2 at position (21.5, 73.5) set to craft iron gear wheels from iron plates, not receiving electricity and has zero energy  
- Small electric poles at positions (18.5, 72.5), (18.5, 75.5), and (21.5, 75.5) intended to provide power connections but assembler remains unpowered  

This structure integrates mining, smelting, assembling, and storage within a compact area, connected by inserters and powered by electric poles. However, fuel shortages in inserters and power connectivity issues are causing blockages and halted production.

ERROR TIPS

### Errors due to assembler not receiving power  
- The assembling machine 2 remains unpowered despite electric poles being placed and connected.  
- Verify that electric poles are correctly positioned to cover the assembler and all inserters requiring power.  
- Confirm the electric poles are connected to a power source and form a continuous power network.  
- Check for any wiring or connection logic errors preventing power delivery to the assembler.  

### Errors inserting coal into burner inserters and mining drills due to empty inventory  
- Multiple attempts to insert coal into burner inserters and mining drills fail because the inventory has no coal available at the time of insertion.  
- Ensure sufficient coal is harvested and stocked in inventory before attempting to insert fuel into burner entities.  
- Implement checks to confirm inventory coal quantity before fuel insertion calls to avoid exceptions.  
- Consider harvesting coal proactively or maintaining a buffer stock to prevent fuel starvation.  

### Errors related to burner inserters running out of fuel and waiting for source or destination space  
- Burner inserters at positions (17.5, 71.5), (19.5, 73.5), and (23.5, 73.5) are out of fuel and unable to operate, causing production bottlenecks.  
- Ensure timely insertion of coal fuel into burner inserters to keep them operational.  
- Monitor fuel levels of burner inserters and automate refueling to prevent stoppages.  

### Errors due to blocked output from burner mining drill and inserters  
- The burner mining drill at (16.0, 71.0) reports output blocked by items on the ground due to no sink entity accepting output.  
- Burner inserters feeding the assembling machine also report waiting for space in destination.  
- Verify that all inserters and chests are correctly positioned and connected to accept outputs without blockage.  
- Adjust inserter drop positions or add additional storage to prevent output congestion.  

### General tips to mitigate placement, power, and fuel errors  
- Before inserting fuel or items, check inventory availability to avoid insertion exceptions.  
- Confirm power pole coverage and network connectivity before relying on electric machines.  
- Maintain fuel supply chains to burner entities to avoid operational downtime.  
- Monitor entity statuses regularly to detect and resolve blockages or shortages early.  

NAMESPACE

No user-defined functions have been defined in the current steps.
